questions.question: The boy worked hard ………………………….. he did not succeed.
questions.description: However is not a conjunction it cannot connect two clauses.

questions.question: …………………………… he is very popular, he cannot be called a great writer.
questions.description: We use though to connect two contrasting ideas.

questions.question: ………………………….. his kind nature, he never had many friends.
questions.description: In spite of is a preposition. It is followed by a noun.

questions.question: …………………………… his homework, he went out to play.
We must eat ………………………… we cannot live.
He bought the estate …………………………. belonged to his uncle.
questions.description: The relative pronoun which refers to things. We use it to connect two clauses.

questions.question: ……………………….. the inflation, the standard of living has increased.
questions.description: Despite is a preposition. It is used before a noun.

questions.question: It is a pity ………………………….. we should have to suffer this humiliation.
…………………………….. you search his pockets, you will find the watch.
The young bride went near the bed ……………………………. the old man could bless her.
